techmeme.title: As Delta experiments with AI-driven pricing, regulators and travelers alike worry about dynamic fare schemes that "go beyond the human cognitive limits" (Max Chafkin/Bloomberg)
DRAM prices remain high after doubling from May 2025 to June 2025, amid speculation that China's CXMT may have halted DDR4 production to focus on DDR5 and HBM (Nikkei Asia)
White House OSTP Director Michael Kratsios says the US is exploring software or physical methods to track the location of AI chips, as part of AI Action Plan (Bloomberg)
Sources: Core Scientific's hedge fund shareholders may reject CoreWeave's all-stock merger bid, seeking better terms, as CRWV has fallen 30%+ post-announcement (Financial Times)
Sources: TSMC fires several employees for violating rules related to obtaining sensitive info on 2nm chip tech; TSMC says it detected "unauthorized activities" (Cheng Ting-Fang/Nikkei Asia)
